whatIsKeplear.response:
Keplear is an ear training app for musicians! Here's what you can do:

‚Ä¢ Practice on **Keyboard**, **Guitar**, or **Bass**
‚Ä¢ Learn and apply **scales** and **chords**
‚Ä¢ **Generate melodies** to train your ear
‚Ä¢ Use your **microphone** for real-time feedback
‚Ä¢ Join **classrooms** for structured learning

Would you like to know more about any specific feature?

navigation.home: To go to the **Home page**, click on the **Keplear logo** in the top left corner of the header. The home page shows an overview of the app and has a 'Start Training Now' button to jump into practice!
navigation.sandbox:
To access the **Sandbox** (practice mode):

1. Click **'Start Training Now'** on the home page, or
2. Click **'Sandbox'** in the header navigation

In Sandbox mode you can select instruments, apply scales/chords, and generate melodies to practice!
navigation.classroom:
To access the **Classroom**:

1. Click **'Classroom'** in the header navigation
2. You'll need to **sign in** to use classroom features

**Teachers** can:
‚Ä¢ Create classrooms (public or private)
‚Ä¢ Create assignments with specific scales/chords

**Students** can:
‚Ä¢ Join classrooms using a class code
‚Ä¢ Complete assignments

features.scales:
**Scales** highlight specific note patterns on your instrument!

**How to use:**
1. Go to **Sandbox** mode
2. Find the **Scales** section in the controls
3. Select a **root note** (C, D, E, etc.)
4. Choose a **scale type** (Major, Minor, Pentatonic, Blues, etc.)
5. Click **'Apply'**

The scale notes will be highlighted on your instrument. Generate a melody to hear them in action!
features.chords:
**Chords** add harmony to your practice!

**How to use:**
1. Go to **Sandbox** mode
2. Find the **Chords** section
3. Select a **root note** and **chord type** (Major, Minor, 7th, etc.)
4. Click **'Apply'**

**Tip:** Use the **Progression/Arpeggiator** toggle:
‚Ä¢ **Progression** = plays full chords together
‚Ä¢ **Arpeggiator** = plays chord notes one at a time
features.melody:
To **generate a melody**:

1. Go to **Sandbox** mode
2. **Apply scales or chords** first (the melody uses these notes)
3. Set your **BPM** (tempo) and **number of beats**
4. Click the **'Generate'** button
5. Click **'Play'** to hear your melody!

The generated melody will use notes from your selected scales/chords. Try different combinations!
features.bpm:
**BPM (Beats Per Minute)** controls the tempo:

‚Ä¢ Find the **BPM input** in Sandbox mode controls
‚Ä¢ Enter a number between **1-999**
‚Ä¢ **Higher BPM** = faster playback
‚Ä¢ **Lower BPM** = slower playback

**Tip:** Start slow (60-80 BPM) when learning, then increase speed as you improve!
features.beats:
**Number of Beats** controls melody length:

‚Ä¢ Find the **beats input** next to BPM in Sandbox
‚Ä¢ Enter how many notes you want in your melody
‚Ä¢ More beats = longer melody

**Tip:** Start with 4-8 beats for simple practice, increase for more challenge!
features.microphone:
**Microphone/Pitch Detection** lets you practice with a real instrument!

**How to use:**
1. In Sandbox mode, find the **microphone** button
2. Click to **enable** microphone access
3. Allow browser permission when prompted
4. Play notes on your real instrument
5. The app will **detect and highlight** the notes you play!

Great for checking if you're playing the right notes in a melody.
features.instruments:
**Keplear supports 3 instruments:**

üéπ **Keyboard** - Piano keys with adjustable octave range
üé∏ **Guitar** - 6-string fretboard
üé∏ **Bass** - 4-string bass fretboard

**To switch instruments:**
1. Go to Sandbox mode
2. Click on the instrument name/tab at the top
3. The display will change to show that instrument

All features work with all instruments!
features.octaveRange:
**Octave Range** (keyboard only):

‚Ä¢ Look for **+/-** buttons near the keyboard display
‚Ä¢ Click **+** to add more octaves (higher/lower keys)
‚Ä¢ Click **-** to remove octaves

This lets you focus on specific ranges or see the full keyboard!
features.theme:
To **change the theme**:

‚Ä¢ Look for the **sun/moon icon** in the header
‚Ä¢ Click it to toggle between **dark** and **light** mode

Your preference is saved automatically!
features.auth:
**To sign in or create an account:**

1. Click **'Sign In'** in the header (top right)
2. Enter your email and password to sign in
3. Or click **'Sign Up'** to create a new account

**Why sign in?**
‚Ä¢ Access **Classroom** features
‚Ä¢ Create and join classes
‚Ä¢ Save your progress
features.assignments:
**Assignments** are created in Classrooms:

**Teachers - Creating assignments:**
1. Go to Classroom and open your class
2. Click **'Add Assignment'**
3. Select scales, chords, instrument, and settings
4. Give it a title and save

**Students - Taking assignments:**
1. Join a classroom using the class code
2. Click on an assignment to start
3. Practice with the pre-configured settings!

knowledgeBase.appDescription: An ear training app for musicians to practice identifying and playing scales, chords, and melodies on keyboard, guitar, or bass.

scales.name: Scales
scales.description: Musical scales that highlight specific notes on your instrument. Available scales include Major, Minor, Pentatonic, Blues, and more.
scales.location: In Sandbox mode, look for the "Scales" section in the control panel.
scales.howToUse: Select a root note (like C, D, E), choose a scale type, then click "Apply" to highlight those notes on your instrument.

chords.name: Chords
chords.description: Chord patterns that can be applied to your instrument. Includes Major, Minor, 7th, and other chord types.
chords.location: In Sandbox mode, look for the "Chords" section in the control panel.
chords.howToUse: Select a root note, choose a chord type, then click "Apply". Use the Progression/Arpeggiator toggle to control how chords are played in melodies.

melodyGeneration.name: Melody Generation
melodyGeneration.description: Automatically generates melodies based on your selected scales and chords.
melodyGeneration.location: In Sandbox mode, click the "Generate" button after applying scales or chords.
melodyGeneration.howToUse: First apply some scales or chords, set your BPM and number of beats, then click "Generate" to create a melody. Click "Play" to hear it.

bpm.name: BPM (Beats Per Minute)
bpm.description: Controls the tempo/speed of melody playback.
bpm.location: In the control panel in Sandbox mode, look for the BPM input field.
bpm.howToUse: Enter a number between 1-999 to set the tempo. Higher numbers = faster playback.

beats.name: Number of Beats
beats.description: Controls how many notes are in a generated melody.
beats.location: In the control panel in Sandbox mode, next to the BPM setting.
beats.howToUse: Enter a number to set how many beats/notes will be in your generated melody.

microphone.name: Microphone / Pitch Detection
microphone.description: Uses your microphone to detect what notes you're playing and provides real-time feedback.
microphone.location: In Sandbox mode, look for the microphone icon or "Start Listening" button.
microphone.howToUse: Click to enable microphone access. Play notes on your real instrument and the app will detect and highlight them.

instruments.name: Instrument Selection
instruments.description: Switch between Keyboard, Guitar, and Bass instruments.
instruments.location: At the top of the Sandbox page, you'll see instrument tabs or a selector.
instruments.howToUse: Click on Keyboard, Guitar, or Bass to switch instruments. Each has its own visual layout.

octaveRange.name: Octave Range
octaveRange.description: Adjust the range of octaves displayed on the keyboard.
octaveRange.location: In Sandbox mode when using Keyboard, look for octave controls.
octaveRange.howToUse: Use the +/- buttons to add or remove octaves from the keyboard display.

chordMode.name: Chord Mode (Progression/Arpeggiator)
chordMode.description: Controls how chords are played in generated melodies. Progression plays full chords, Arpeggiator plays notes individually.
chordMode.location: In the control panel when chords are applied.
chordMode.howToUse: Toggle between "Progression" and "Arpeggiator" to change how chord notes are played in melodies.

theme.name: Dark/Light Theme
theme.description: Switch between dark and light visual themes.
theme.location: In the header, look for a sun/moon icon.
theme.howToUse: Click the theme toggle icon to switch between dark and light modes.

authentication.name: Sign In / Sign Up
authentication.description: Create an account or sign in to access Classroom features and save progress.
authentication.location: In the header, click "Sign In" or the user icon.
authentication.howToUse: Click Sign In to log in with existing account, or Sign Up to create a new account.

home.name: Home Page
home.description: The landing page with an overview of Keplear and a button to start training.
home.howToAccess: Click on the Keplear logo in the header or navigate to the home page.
home.features: Start Training button, App overview, Instrument showcase

sandbox.name: Sandbox / Practice Mode
sandbox.description: The main practice area where you can select instruments, apply scales and chords, generate melodies, and train your ear.
sandbox.howToAccess: Click "Start Training Now" on the home page, or click "Sandbox" in the header navigation.
sandbox.features: Instrument selection, Scale selection, Chord selection, Melody generation, BPM and beats control, Microphone pitch detection, Octave range adjustment, Fret zone selection

classroom.name: Classroom
classroom.description: A space for teachers to create classrooms and assignments, and for students to join and complete assignments.
classroom.howToAccess: Click "Classroom" in the header navigation. You need to be signed in to use this feature.
classroom.features: Create classrooms, Join classrooms with a code, Create assignments, Take assignments, Public and private options

keyboard.name: Keyboard
keyboard.description: A piano keyboard interface with adjustable octave range.
keyboard.tips: Click on keys to hear notes. Use octave controls to show more or fewer octaves. Selected notes are highlighted in color.

guitar.name: Guitar
guitar.tips: Click on fret positions to hear notes. Use fret zone selection to focus on specific areas. Standard tuning: E-A-D-G-B-E.

bass.name: Bass
bass.tips: Click on fret positions to hear notes. Standard tuning: E-A-D-G. Great for practicing bass lines and root notes.
